column2: as Morocco become Africa's first World Cup semi-finalists by bravely beating Portugal in Al Thumama. Defending relentlessly and exhibiting great skill on the break
column3: the Atlas Lions roar into the final four thanks to En-Nesyri's magnificent first-half header. Even with several injuries to contend with
column4: they delight their hordes of noisy fans
column7: a high-stakes clash with England or France awaits.

column1: 42'	MOROCCO LEAD! At the third time of asking
column2: En-Nesyri strikes! Having missed two earlier headed chances
column3: the Sevilla striker leaps brilliantly to beat Costa to a cross from the left by Attiyat-Allah. He nods the ball into the back of the unguarded net; putting the Atlas Lions 1-0 ahead just before the break!
